TopicTitle: Download of KSP (linux version) from kerbalspaceprogram.com won't complete!

Articles.Content:
Hey all,

I'm trying to set KSP up on a new computer, and need the Linux version of the game for it - the one on my old decrepit comp is Windows, so it won't just copy over. However, I can't manage to get a complete download from the KSP store - it'll get up to about 100- 120mb and then stop, unable to get going again. I'm not sure if this is an issue with my ISP or the KSP site or something else. Are there any approved download mirrors or anything? Anything odd going on with the servers today?

Thanks in advance.

Edit: proof [http://i.imgur.com/Gdkb8Xe.png](http://i.imgur.com/Gdkb8Xe.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T01:27:01Z" title="07/25/2015 01:27  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by Coyote27**
Hi Coyote27, the download is working, can you try another browser?
Well, it worked today. Maybe it's my ISP's fault, then! Anyway, time to once more start launching into space...
I have this problem. It won't work on Firefox on my Ubuntu gaming computer or on my mac, but it does on chrome on windows, so I guess that's the solution.
